title: Thorn Whip
content:
Thorn Whip Transmutation Cantrip Pulls the creature 3m closer to you. The target can't be pulled if it is Huge in size. 9m Action

Transmutation Cantrip

Pulls the creature 3m closer to you.

The target can't be pulled if it is Huge in size.

Thorn Whip is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Thorn Whip is a Cantrip from the Transmutation school. Spells are regulated forms of magic energy that can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflicting Status Effects, buffing Characters, or interacting with the environment. While casting usually Spells uses up Spell Slots, the number of which a character has is increased as the character increases in spellcaster Classes' levels, Cantrips are Spells that can be cast without using up Spell Slots. To balance this out, Cantrips usually are weaker Spells, that are mainly used as utility both inside and outside of battle. That being said, Cantrips can prove to be powerful depending on how a character uses them.

Baldur's Gate 3 Thorn Whip Information

Description: Pulls the creature 3m closer to you. The target can't be pulled if it is Huge in size Level: Cantrip School: Transmutation School Casting Time: Action Range: 9m Requires Concentration: No

How to Acquire Thorn Whip in Baldur's Gate 3

Thorn Whip can be acquired by the following classes: Druid, Nature Domain, Warlock (Pact of the Tome) Thorn Whip can be cast by using the following Items: Sorrow (Named "Sorrowful Lash" - a stronger version)

Thorn Whip Tips & Notes

Upcast: This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6) and 10th level (3d6). Using Thorn Whip in specific situations, like pulling Enemies into an ongoing area of effect Spell, or even just simply down from up to nine meters high will have grave consequences for your targets.
